data.title: [build error]Cross Compiling for ARM platform on ubuntu
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: latest (git clone)
- OS Version: 
lsb_release -a
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
Description:	Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS
Release:	16.04
Codename:	xenial

Node version: v6.6.0
npm version : 4.4.1
Steps to Reproduce:
Following the steps: [wiki/Cross-Compiling-for-Debian-Based-Linux](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Cross-Compiling-for-Debian-Based-Linux)

data.title: How to make VSCode to replace the word when accepting autocomplete hint?
data.body:
When I tried to open an issue here, I got below hint.

> Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode

So I did, and opened a question on SO[1], hoping that someone from VSCode team would answer, but seems like no one is tracking these questions. Let me repeat the question here.



JetBrains IDE platform have very useful feature, which I am using a lot and I find it a performance booster. When I have a word in editor, and I want to change or update that word, I do the following.

- Place cursor in front of the word (or in middle, ex. when I want to change only last part.)
- Start typing until I got autocomplete I want to use.
- Press TAB or ENTER.
  - On TAB - Old word is completely replaced by new word. This is especially useful when I update some names, in which beginning of word is the same, but ending is different. For example, change getTimeInSeconds() to getTimeInMinutes() - I put cursor after getTimeIn, get autocomplete, and press TAB. Nothing left to delete, everything is replaced.
  - On ENTER - New word is replaced from the start of old word, but right part from the cursor stays on screen.

By default VSCode supports only "ENTER" use case. Does it support "TAB" use case? If so, how to enable it?

---

[1] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/41948329/how-to-make-vscode-to-replace-the-word-when-accepting-autocomplete-hint

data.title: Preferences search can't search backwards
data.body:
I was building from source and noticed that the new preferences search can only search forward and doesn't respond to shift+enter to search backwards.

I can see that it is because it uses the IIterator<T> interface, but the actual datastructure it uses implements INavigator<T> which supports going backwards.

I have a PR ready if this is something that you're interested in changing.

data.title: Method Folding doesn't work correctly
data.body:
Version 1.10.2
Commit 8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331
Date 2017-03-08T14:00:46.854Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

Description: Instead of folding methods by mtaching glower brackets , VS code is folding methods by matching indentation in cpp.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write a function that is poorly indented. Have a line appear at 0 indentation. 
2. Now try to fold the method, it folds up to that line but not beyond it

Eg method:
```
`std::vector< CurvatureInfo > GetCurvatures( const std::vector< PlyOrientedVertex< float > >& plyVertices , const std::vector< TriangleIndex >& triangles )
{
	std::vector< CurvatureInfo > curvatures( triangles.size() );

	// Compute the principal curvature directions and values
	// (The first principal curvature value/direction should be the one with the largest value)
#pragma message ( "[WARNING] Missing code here" )

	return curvatures;
}`
```


Folding this would fold up to #pragma but not beyond it

data.title: Automatically delete +1 comments
data.body:
Feature requests are riddled with "+1" comments that spam everyone's emails unless notifications are disabled.

I suggest you to use [something like this](https://github.com/keith/vote-knope) to automatically delete them.

data.title: Hotkey for displaying a hidden menu is accepted even when combined with other modifier keys

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set the menu to hidden by default
2. Leave the hotkey for showing the menu as the default (`ALT` in my case)
3. Press `ALT` + `CTRL` or `ALT` + `SHIFT`
4. The menu is displayed on key release

It is pretty common for me to start to use a hotkey combination and then change my mind and let go of the modifier keys before pressing the main hotkey. If those modifiers included the `ALT` key, the menu is displayed even if other modifier keys were also being pressed at the same time.

data.title: When the menu is hidden by default, toggling should be temporary, and dismissed by non-menu actions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set the menu to be hidden by default
2. Press `ALT` to display the menu
3. Change your mind about needing the menu and continue typing in the editor instead

Issues:

- The menu doesn't go away unless `ALT` is pressed a second time
- Hotkey mnemonics continue to be displayed

If the menu is hidden by default, displaying it should be treated as a transient interaction. If the next interaction does not involve the menu, the menu should be re-hidden automatically.

data.title: Backspace doesn't handle zero width joiners (and combining marks) correctly.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.2 (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T14:02:52.799Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.9.2|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. paste this emoji: 👩‍👩‍👧‍👧
2. hit backspace

Expected: deletes entire emoji (like it does in this html form).
Result: deletes the right kid, leaving you with 👩‍👩‍👧‍.

I've had this same bug in my own code once.  It's because javascript has derpy non-utf-8 strings.  Single utf-8 characters will be multiple javascript string characters.  I don't know the correct terminology, but just play with it and see what I mean.  I found the correct way to delete character off javascript strings to be:

```
                    var chars = Array.from(text);
                    chars.pop();
                    text = chars.join('');
```

data.title: Still can't launch external programs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.0 (compiled from source just now)
- OS Version: Arch Linux (kernel 4.10.1-1-ARCH)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use zsh or another non-bash shell, I've heard it's tied to this but cannot confirm as changing shell doesn't fix it for me
2. Attempt to launch an external program in your build command.

Even after the recent issue #21655 and #22152 which was supposed to be fixed by [this](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/78bc68a1d06403ffc02f61e0043af682e8f3d681) commit (for which I have verified the changes in the relevant file), I get the same issue as I did before. That is, when trying to launch cargo I get this error:
```
Failed to launch external program cargo run.
spawn cargo ENOENT
```

My tasks.json is about as simple as it gets, so I do not think the issue lies there - it is however enclosed just in case:

```json
{
    // See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558
    // for the documentation about the tasks.json format
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "cargo",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": ["run"],
    "showOutput": "always",
    "isBuildCommand": true
}
```
I have additionally verified that this is the tasks.json file being used by making changes and seeing those reflected in the error message.

The cargo command is attempted in a valid cargo directory which cargo shows no objection to when ran manually via terminal, displaying the correct output for the compiled program.

I do not experience this issue in the Windows version of VSCode. 

I've tried to be as inclusive of all necessary details as possible, hopefully it's something simple which I've done wrong. Thanks in advance!

data.title: Spread operator can break JS highlighting.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Place this code in a JS file:

    ```js
    myFunc
    (...argName)
    
    function otherFunc() {} // <-- Not highlighted.
    ```
Remove the spread operator or the line break and the highlighting works again.

## Why fix this?
The parser used by VSCode is plainly in error. And FWIW, stuff like this is useful when working with higher-order functions:

```js

funcName
  (...someArgs)
  (someMore)
  (someMoreAgain)

```

data.title: Add "isFolder" capability to explorer/context when clauses
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows

In my extension, I would like to provide context menu actions that only display when a folder is selected. The "explorer/context" commands use the `when` clauses to allow filtering based on the file language, but it appears there's currently no way to reliably distinguish between a file and a folder. The closest way is to check "!resourceLangId", but that will evaluate to true if the file is not associated with a language (e.g. "my_file.abc123")

Is it possible to add something like "isFolder" to the context?
